intro: Meliosma rhoifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves that are typically silver-white underneath, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types. It produces small, yellowish flowers in spring, followed by edible, winged fruits. The tree is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and adaptability.
